item.title: 申博姆称墨西哥获得新的关税缓期，90 天内达成贸易协议
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆周四表示，她在与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的通话中争取到了暂停新关税生效和90天的贸易协议谈判期。【原文：Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Thursday that she secured a pause on new tariffs coming into effect and a 90-day period to work on a trade deal in a call with U.S. President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 在 Epic Games 案中，谷歌就应用商店改革提出的上诉败诉
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周四未能说服美国上诉委员会推翻陪审团的裁决和联邦法院要求该科技巨头改造其应用程序商店 Play 的命令。【原文：Alphabet’s Google on Thursday failed to persuade a U.S. appeals panel to overturn a jury verdict and federal court order requiring the technology giant to revamp its app store Play.】

item.title: 微软称俄罗斯安全局在网络间谍活动中以外国驻莫斯科使馆为目标
item.description: 微软公司周四表示，俄罗斯政府的一个主要网络间谍单位正在利用当地的互联网服务提供商部署恶意软件，攻击驻莫斯科的使馆和外交机构。【原文：One of the Russian government’s premier cyber espionage units is deploying malware against embassies and diplomatic organizations in Moscow by leveraging local internet service providers, Microsoft said on Thursday.】

item.title: 参议院最高民主党人批评联合太平洋公司收购诺福克南方公司的交易
item.description: 参议院民主党领袖查克-舒默（Chuck Schumer）批评联合太平洋公司（Union Pacific）计划以 850 亿美元的交易价格收购诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern），从而创建美国首家海岸至海岸货运铁路运营商。【原文：Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer criticized Union Pacific's plan to acquire Norfolk Southern in a $85 billion deal to create the first U.S. coast-to-coast freight rail operator.】

item.title: 消息人士称，约 15.4 万名联邦工作人员接受了特朗普政府的买断提议
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士周四表示，今年约有15.4万名联邦雇员接受了特朗普政府提供的买断服务，这是为精简联邦员工队伍而采取的更广泛措施的一部分。【原文：Roughly 154,000 federal employees have taken buyouts offered by the Trump administration this year, part of a broader push to slim the federal workforce, a person familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: CK Hutchison- 经营的巴拿马港口可能由国家合伙接管，总统说
item.description: 巴拿马总统何塞-劳尔-穆利诺（Jose Raul Mulino）周四表示，如果法院宣布与香港长江和记黄埔签订的运营巴拿马运河附近两个重要港口的合同无效，那么公私合营企业将接管这两个港口。【原文：Public-private partnerships could take over two key ports near the Panama Canal if courts invalidate a contract with Hong Kong-based CK Hutchison's to operate them, Panama's President Jose Raul Mulino said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国停止减免包裹税威胁 eBay 和 Etsy 交易
item.description: 下个月，在 eBay 和 Etsy 等平台上购买二手、古董或手工制品的美国人将面临高额的国际购物关税，这可能会损害这些点对点网站的贸易。【原文：Americans shopping for secondhand, vintage or handmade items on platforms like eBay and Etsy face steep customs duties on international purchases next month, potentially hurting trade on those peer-to-peer sites.】

item.title: 分析师称埃克森、雪佛龙利润将降至大流行病以来最低点
item.description: 由于石油和天然气价格下跌导致收入减少，美国顶级石油生产商埃克森美孚（Exxon Mobil）和雪佛龙（Chevron）周五发布的第二季度财报预计将创下四年来的最低收益。【原文：Top U.S. oil producers Exxon Mobil and Chevron are expected to report their lowest earnings in four years when they release second-quarter results on Friday, as weaker oil and gas prices slashed revenue.】

item.title: 高盛任命资深人士迈克尔-汤普森（Michael Thompson）为政府与监管事务主管
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部备忘录，华尔街重量级公司高盛（Goldman Sachs）已任命资深人士迈克尔-汤普森（Michael Thompson）为政府与监管事务办公室全球主管。【原文：Wall Street heavyweight Goldman Sachs has appointed veteran Michael Thompson as the global head of the office of government and regulatory affairs, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 菲拉格慕在上半年亏损后推出行动计划
item.description: 意大利奢侈品集团 Salvatore Ferragamo（菲拉格慕）表示，在应对消费者需求下降和宏观经济不确定性的同时，该公司已制定了一项重振销售和重新推出品牌的计划。【原文：Italian luxury group Salvatore Ferragamo said it had put in place a plan to revive sales and relaunch its brand as it deals with eroding consumer demand and macroeconomic certainty.】

item.title: 法拉利股价暴跌 12%，创 2016 年上市以来最大跌幅
item.description: 法拉利股价周四下跌超过 12%，创下自九年前上市以来的最大单日跌幅，尽管这家豪华跑车制造商表示将削减在美国的价格，但仍维持其指导价。【原文：Ferrari shares fell more than 12% on Thursday, setting the stock for its biggest one-day drop since its listing nine years ago, even as the luxury sports car maker maintained its guidance, although it said it would cut back prices in the U.S..】

item.title: 马斯克的神经链接公司将在英国开展临床研究
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的大脑植入公司Neuralink周四表示，将在英国启动一项临床研究，测试其芯片如何使重度瘫痪患者能够用意念控制数字和物理工具。【原文：Elon Musk's brain implant company Neuralink said on Thursday it will launch a clinical study in Great Britain to test how its chips can enable patients with severe paralysis to control digital and physical tools with their thoughts.】

item.title: 印度 PB 金融科技公司因健康保险业蓬勃发展而实现季度利润增长
item.description: 印度 PB Fintech 公司周四公布第一季度利润增长 40%，原因是越来越多的消费者转向数字平台购买保险产品。【原文：India's PB Fintech reported a 40% rise in first-quarter profit on Thursday, as more consumers turned to digital platforms for insurance products.】

item.title: 特朗普称墨西哥贸易协议延长 90 天
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，他已与墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）达成一致，同意将与墨西哥的现有贸易协议延长90天，并在此期间继续谈判，目标是签署一项新协议。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had agreed with Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum to extend an existing trade deal with Mexico for 90 days and continue talks over that period with the goal of signing a new deal.】

item.title: 以色列网络初创公司 Noma Security 在一轮私人融资中筹集到 1 亿美元资金
item.description: 以色列网络安全初创公司Noma Security周四表示，该公司的平台可保护企业数据和人工智能模型免受人工智能代理的攻击，该公司在一轮私募融资中筹集了1亿美元，使迄今为止筹集的资金总额达到1.32亿美元。【原文：Israeli cybersecurity startup Noma Security, whose platform secures enterprise data and AI models against AI agents, said on Thursday it raised $100 million in a private funding round, bringing total funds raised to date to $132 million.】

item.title: 随着零售交易日趋成熟，Robinhood 度过了 "备忘录 "狂热时代
item.description: Robinhood 的财报凸显了这款曾经是 "meme-stock "狂热中心的应用程序是如何发展成为一个更广泛的平台，让散户投资者即使在市场动荡时也能保持参与。【原文：Robinhood's earnings highlight how the app once at the center of the meme-stock mania has evolved into a broader platform to keep retail investors engaged even during market turbulence.】

item.title: 必和必拓和淡水河谷被指控 "欺骗 "英国律师事务所 17 亿美元酬金
item.description: 必和必拓公司和淡水河谷公司正面临代表数十万巴西最严重环境灾难受害者的律师事务所在伦敦提起的诉讼，指控这两家公司试图通过促成和解来骗取律师事务所的律师费。【原文：BHP and Vale are facing a London lawsuit from the law firm representing hundreds of thousands of people over Brazil's worst environmental disaster, alleging the companies sought to cheat the firm out of legal fees by procuring settlements.】

item.title: 解说员：美国限制废铜出口的计划会产生什么影响？
item.description: 美国计划从 2027 年起限制废铜出口，要求至少保留 25% 的所谓 "优质 "废铜供国内使用。【原文：The United States is planning to restrict scrap copper exports from 2027, requiring that at least 25% of so-called “high-quality” scrap be retained for domestic use.】

item.title: 全球商业团体称，随着企业抛售关税前库存，价格上涨可能很快就会到来
item.description: 据国际商会称，与关税相关的价格上涨可能会在第三季度末开始显现，因为届时各公司可能已经抛售了在新关税实施前积累的美国库存。【原文：Tariff-related price hikes may start to bite at the end of the third quarter as companies may by then have sold off U.S. stockpiles built up ahead of the new duties, according to the International Chamber of Commerce.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司 Anaconda 获 1.5 亿美元 C 轮融资，Insight Partners 领投
item.description: Anaconda是数据科学和人工智能开源Python软件的领先提供商，在由Insight Partners领投、阿布扎比穆巴达拉资本（Mubadala Capital）跟投的C轮融资中筹集了超过1.5亿美元。【原文：Anaconda, a leading provider of open-source Python software for data science and AI, has raised more than $150 million in a Series C funding round led by Insight Partners, with additional participation from Abu Dhabi's Mubadala Capital.】

item.title: 法国农业信贷银行的 "乌龟 "战略在意大利并购竞赛中取得成功
item.description: 当一些欧盟国家政府希望在银行业的任何重组中拥有发言权时，欧洲银行首席执行官们正在研究并购举措，他们应该参考法国农业信贷银行的交易手册。【原文：European bank CEOs studying M&A moves at a time when some EU governments want a say in any reshaping of their banking industry should look at the dealmaking playbook of Credit Agricole .】

item.title: 美国电话电报公司将在纽约证券交易所德克萨斯州上市
item.description: 无线运营商 AT&T 周四表示，它将从 8 月 1 日起在纽约证券交易所德克萨斯分部双重上市。【原文：Wireless carrier AT&T said on Thursday it will dual list on the NYSE Texas, effective August 1.】

item.title: 飓风对医疗产品部门的影响挥之不去，百特下调预期，业绩不及预期
item.description: 百特国际公司周四下调了 2025 年的利润预期，由于飓风海伦（Helene）的持续影响，该公司的一个关键生产设施受损，对静脉注射液的需求减少，季度盈利未能达到分析师的预期。【原文：Baxter International cut its 2025 profit forecast on Thursday, while quarterly earnings missed analysts' estimates due to the lingering effect of Hurricane Helene, which damaged a key manufacturing facility and reduced demand for IV solutions.】

item.title: 英国出口金融公司为福特英国公司的 10 亿英镑贷款提供担保
item.description: 英国政府机构正在向美国汽车制造商福特公司的英国分公司提供 10 亿英镑的出口发展担保，以支持该公司在全球的长期发展目标。【原文：A British government agency is providing a 1 billion pound export development guarantee to the UK arm of U.S. carmaker Ford , supporting the company's long-term growth targets around the world.】

item.title: 美国第二季度劳动力成本增幅略超预期
item.description: 美国第二季度劳动力成本增幅略高于预期，原因是工资增长回升，而劳动力市场状况正在趋于缓和。【原文：U.S. labor costs increased slightly more than expected in the second quarter amid a pick-up in wage growth even as labor market conditions are easing.】

item.title: 美国财政部长称有望年底前宣布美联储主席人选
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周四表示，他正在整理一份领导美国联邦储备委员会的潜在候选人名单，预计将在今年年底前公布。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Thursday he is pulling together a list of potential candidates to lead the U.S. Federal Reserve and that he expects an announcement by the end of the year.】

item.title: 亨廷顿-英格尔斯公司季度业绩高居榜首，造船业困境有所缓解
item.description: 美国军用造船厂亨廷顿-英格尔斯（Huntington Ingalls）周四公布的第二季度业绩高于华尔街预期，原因是其造船厂的生产问题有所缓解，而且对潜艇的需求大增。【原文：U.S. military shipbuilder Huntington Ingalls reported second-quarter results above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, as production issues ease at its shipyards and demand booms for submarines.】

item.title: 美国消费支出紧缩，凯拉诺瓦季度利润不及预期
item.description: 由于宏观经济的不确定性给消费者支出带来压力，包括 Pringles 和 Pop-Tarts 在内的即食早餐和零食需求疲软，凯兰诺瓦公司周四公布的第二季度利润不及华尔街预期。【原文：Kellanova missed Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit on Thursday on softening demand for its ready-to-eat breakfast items and snacks including Pringles and Pop-Tarts, as macroeconomic uncertainty pressures consumer spending.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数小幅上升
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量略有增加，表明劳动力市场保持稳定，尽管下岗工人需要更长的时间才能找到新的工作机会。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits increased marginally last week, suggesting that the labor market remained stable, though it is taking longer for laid-off workers to find new opportunities.】

item.title: 美国 6 月通胀回升；消费支出温和增长
item.description: 进口关税开始提高一些商品的成本。【原文：Tariffs on imports started raising the cost of some goods.】
